intro: Gilgiochloa, commonly known as the golden grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family, Poaceae. It is native to various regions of Africa, particularly in tropical and subtropical areas. The plants are characterized by their tall, slender stems and bright yellow inflorescences, which give them their common name. Gilgiochloa species are often found in open woodlands and savannas, where they thrive in well-drained soils. They are not only ornamental but also play a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
